intro: Centaurea araxina, commonly known as the Armenian knapweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and Turkey. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–80 cm, with slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its bright yellow flowers are surrounded by pale blue or white ray florets, and it produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Centaurea araxina is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to temperate to cold climates.
